This event is all about the battle and race between two bots for collecting more jewels and more score points. 

STATEMENT-(Wired or wireless) 
1. There will be a competition between two bots.Firstly the bots will face an individual track of two meters having some hurdles and the obstacles through which they have to reach to the battle arena. 
2. In battle arena jewels (jewels are in the shape of cube having dimensions (3*3)inch.) are placed at specifics points different jewels having different values. 
3. Queen jewel; having maximum points. (Only one will be provided per round) 
4. The battle arena having two specified area for each bots where they put their jewels. 
5. The bot can oppose the other bot to collect the jewels and can also drag out the scored jewels of opponent team. 
6. The queen jewel can’t be drag out from the one area once it is scored by one team. 
7. There is no time limit. 
8. There will be elimination rounds. 
9. The event having two rounds R1 AND R2. In which R2 is final round. 
10. The positions will be according to the scores gained. 

 ROBOTS 
1. The size should not exceed 30cm*30cm of dimensions. 
2. Weight should not exceed 1.5kg. 
3. Robot should not use more than 12volt power supply. 
4. The substitution of robots during the competition within the team or other teams is forbidden. 
5. No physical intervention in the arena would be tolerated. This would lead to direct disqualification. 
6. Robots should be controlled by the designated controller and not by physical pulling and pushing. 

 EVENT RULES AND REGULATIONS:- 
1. Team size = 4 members (max). 
2. The judge’s decision at any point would be final. 
3. The organizers have the right to disqualify anyone if any team breaks any rule. 
4. Teams cannot make changes on the robots during a round. They can, however, make any changes between successive rounds. 
5.Any kind of weapons that are intentionally added to harm the opponent robot would not be accepted. 
6. If special circumstances, such as unforeseen problems, rules maybe modified by the organizers, if necessary even during any event. 
7. It is expected that all participants, students and spectators, respect the event. It is not whether you win or lose, but how much you learn that counts.
